reviews.text:
Darul Aman Palace (Persian: قصر دارالامان‎; Pashto: د دارالامان ماڼۍ‎; "abode of peace" or, in a double meaning "abode of Aman[ullah]")[1] is a ruined palace located about 16 kilometres (9.9 mi) south-west outside of the center of Kabul, Afghanistan. As of 2017, progress is being made on a major project intended to fully renovate the building by 2019.[2]
Wikipedia
This place was ruined during the civil war. Recently the government has taken an initiative to rebuild and renovate it. It's historical monument built in the early 2pth century. Deserves a visit.
A palace dating back to the time of Shah Amanullah Khan has just been rebuilt

Darul Aman Palace:
 Is a ruined palace located about sixteen kilometers (ten miles) south-west outside of the center of Kabul, Afghanistan. 
As of 2017, progress is being made on a major project intended to fully renovate the building by 2019.
New photo of Dar_ul_aman
It is newly renovated and lots of changes have been done there in recent years.

History of Kabul Zoo

The zoo was inaugurated in 1967 with a focus on Afghan fauna, being very popular with visitors and press. The zoo once had more than 500 animals with about 150,000 visitors coming to see them in 1972. The zoo suffered significant damage during the 1990s civil war; the aquarium was damaged by shelling, and combatants took the deer and rabbits for food.
It was a good place for who that they want to see different animals.
I love it, but I wish to see this tiger awake, he is sleeping all the day. I went 2 times there but I didn't see him awake. At least upload a pic of him,
Nice place for entertaining Alon and woth family

The National Museum of Afghanistan, also known as the Kabul Museum, is a two-story building located 9 km southwest of the center of Kabul in Afghanistan. As of 2014, the museum is under major expansion according to international standards, with a larger size adjoining garden for visitors to relax and walk around. Wikipedia

museums in the world. Its exhibits, ranging from Hellenistic gold coins to Buddhist statuary and Islamic bronzes, testified to Afghanistan’s location at the crossroads of Asia. After years of abuse during the civil war, help from the international community and the peerless dedication of its staff means the museum is slowly rising from the ashes. The museum opened in 1919, and was almost entirely stocked with items excavated in Afghanistan. As the fall of communist Kabul became apparent with the Soviet withdrawal, many of the most valuable pieces were moved into secure storage, but the majority of exhibits remained in situ. Unfortunately the museum quickly found itself on the frontline of the mujaheddin’s terrible fight for Kabul. Between 1992 and ’94 the museum was used as a mujaheddin base. During this period the museum was massively looted – not just ransacked – but with care taken to select the most valuable pieces for resale on the illicit antique market (the museum’s library and inventory was also lost at this time, to hamper efforts to trace the provenance of stolen goods). Among the priceless treasures lost include many of the Bagram Ivories, the Kunduz Hoard of Graeco-Bactrian coins and unique Gandharan statues of Buddha. During this looting, the museum was further damaged by a rocket attack that destroyed its upper floor. When the Rabbani government regained control of the area, soldiers posted to guard the site continued ad hoc looting of their own. On capturing Kabul in 1996 the Taliban vowed to protect what remained, but it was a short-lived promise.

Kabul Museum, is a two-story building located 9 km southwest of the center of Kabul in Afghanistan. As of 2014, the museum is under major expansion according to international standards, with a larger size adjoining garden for visitors to relax and walk around.
The museum was once considered to be one of the world's finest.

The museum's collection had earlier been one of the most important in Central Asia,with over 100,000 items dating back several millennia. With the start of the civil war in 1992, the museum was looted numerous times resulting in a loss of 70% of the 100,000 objects on display.
Since 2007, a number of international organizations have helped to recover over 8,000 artifacts, the most recent being a limestone sculpture from Germany.
Approximately 843 artifacts were returned by the United Kingdom in 2012, including the famous 1st Century Bagram Ivories.
This museum went through so much still lovely place to visit.
very nice place

One of the most tasty chapli kebab
Kabab are very popular and tasty

One of the famous chapli kabab center
Da zeya number kho rasind kai

I was pleasantly surprised how good the food is here! It is a modest store front but don't let it fool you! The pizza is great, you can taste the freshness. Sooo much better than the big chain companies. The pasta was amazing! 12$ and you get a giant serving, enough for four bowls of pasta with garlic knots and a side salad. Highly recommend the napoletana linguine. Service was great too. They went out of their way to provide extra napkins and side of ranch.

Based on online reviews and its close proximity to my hotel, I ordered delivery during my stay in Ann Arbor.  I ordered a half Greek salad and an Italian sausage pizza.  The salad was pure perfection!  I highly recommend it.  The pizza was also very good (I enjoyed leftovers the next day, too).  I took off one star because the delivery didn't include napkins or utensils.  I mean, I'm staying in a hotel--do you really expect me to have these things readily on hand?  I had to go down to the front desk and request a plastic fork so I could eat my salad.  You guys have great food, so please don't forget the little things that travelers in hotels need.  :)

Just get pizza from this place. Chicken or Pasta is waste of money. Pizza is the best. Do not dine in. Order to go. Bathroom is horrible. They have cleaning problem. The lady who run the place trying her best she is nice. But they need to spend money on the place.

I don't know how this place has so many good reviews. I tried them for the first time last night and will not return. I stopped in for carryout pizza by the slice for my boyfriend and me. First of all, the layout of the restaurant is dysfunctional. The kitchen/working area is so small, I don't know how the three employees were able to move around. And that's another thing. The floor behind the counter has plastic pallets on it and the employees were walking around on the pallets. It was one of the strangest things I've ever seen in a pizza place. The cash register is on a small counter where other customers were just standing around waiting for their orders, so it was impossible to try to place my order and pay. After forcing my way to the register, I ordered two cheese and two pepperoni slices. The cashier could barely figure out how to price them. Cheese and pepperoni are the most basic thing you can order! There were two other customers waiting for their orders and the staff was clearly confused who was supposed to get what order. The employees were running around manically and acting like they could barely comprehend what was going on in the store with three customers! I also noticed there was no hand washing going on as food was being handled. No employee had a clear designated spot to work. They were all just doing whatever. Who manages like that? When I finally received my order they only gave me three slices. I repeated my order of two cheese and two pepperoni. A few minutes later I received my order in a small box and thought to myself "how in the world are there four slices of New York style pizza in here? Did the employee stack them on top of each other?" I was so annoyed I walked out to my car, opened the box, and guess what? Three slices of pizza stacked on top of each other. Unbelievable is all I could think. And who stacks pizza on top of each other? I walked back in and told them my order was still wrong.  A different employee took a slice of cheese pizza, threw some pepperoni on top, and put it in the oven. This is weird, right? Then she pulled it out of the oven and told me to have a great night in an extremely phony voice. She didn't even apologize for the poor service. When I was a teenager, I worked at Cottage Inn, a restaurant with a very large menu and variety of items. I could run the register, take orders, and make all the food by myself on a busy night. It might be hard, but I could certainly handle it on my own. This place can't even get pizza by the slice right with two attempts and three employees working. I was extremely embarrassed for them and would hate to see what it's like when they're actually busy. The pizza was mediocre. Try at your own risk!

My husband liked their pizza a lot and ordered from them dozens of times we recently moved and are now 4 miles away if you view the longest google map route. We have had them deliver before as the route max time also shows as 9 minutes after placing our order and waiting over 30 minutes we received a call back saying we are too far and they will not deliver to us, this woman is the same rude woman we have spoken to before. We were told it would be arriving in 45 minutes when we placed our order and gave our address and he took our payment information as usual. The correct thing to do would have been to call and apologize call back explain they would still deliver our order but in the future they will no longer deliver. She also stated we are over 6 miles away which is not true no matter what route you take. She said it's just too far and did not offer any apology. This is very expensive for what you get- we are dissapointes with our experience and would not recommend this and will be going to many of the other 50 pizza options instead from now on.

it’s to good wings are to die delicious food healthy clean place love it 
keep it on

Very delicious Ice cream.
The new price are expensive but they have tasty chicken.
A Restaurant in Dushanbe, providing Indian Cuisine. Good in serving snacks like Samosas, Jalebi. For meals, very good in Vegetables, Chaney,etc. but not in meat dishes.

Food is better as compared to tajik restaurants,
But not according to the prices,
Long wait but good meal.
Good Indian food !! Nice ambiance .worth for money..it take some good time to get your food !!
Desi food with prathas and much more.. especially onion patato pakoora and smoosa
The food is nice as well as the environment
It ia good don't have good Hotel
Had a good evening there. The personnels' behaviour is mind-blowing.
Very cosy place

The food is reasonable and you can fine typical Kabuli roasts and brown rice here. The Restaurant is located in the heart of secure area of Kabul and is quote fortified as any other place in the city. interior is not very well decorated and parking might be an issue as well because its situated right in the middle of the main shopping area and there is hardly any place on this busy road to park your vehicle and the restaurant does not have any parking inside the facility. .

Worst buffet I've ever been too, all the meat was hard, wouldn't be surprised if it was sitting all day, selection was also really poor. Especially for the price! Don't waste your money or your time and don't chance your gut either STAY AWAY

The worst Chinese food I’ve had in ages. Had the vegetarian chop suey and it was just sprouts, 3 small pieces of celery, and 4 small pieces of carrots. Egg roll was awful. Spring rolls were disgusting. Avoid at all costs!

We didn’t eat their buffet but saw all the food sit there untouched for 45minutes. Def would avoid the buffet. 

Wow that was awful.
We always done take out. Always good good never had a bad experience.
I woulded eat there ever

I got food poisoning once there. The second time the waitress insulted my son. I will never darken their door again!
Go somewhere else!
Wow. Very tasty and healthy
Very good food good service
Love the service here. It's overcrowded sometimes. Best Turkish and local food. Highly recommended for a visit.
Great Turkish food and great service.
It is a really good hotel with delicious Turkish food, Cuisine and Water pipe or Qalion
Great place and great pizza
Can find good fish and burgers here

Great pizza     enjoyed... serve a pizza a real pizza...
 try a fish pizza
Not the best fast food restaurant in the world, but it is the best fast food restaurant I've seen in Kabul

buen sitio, huele un pko mal pero se como bien
very beautiful setting indoor and outdoor. the restaurant sits on a beautiful lake. the food is amazing. I had the sea bass which was delicious. the ambiance is amazing here. it is a must see

First time I dined in this elegant restaurant, I instantly fell in love with the food, service, and ambiance. We had an anniversary lunch back in May and it was fabulous. Today, I'm having dinner with family and this place never fails to impress. Never thought I would find a place where I could have very good herb and garlic butter escargot. Last good one I had was in Florida. I'm so happy I found a restaurant that can make it so perfectly. 

This will be my go-to place for very special occasions. Simply one of the best Italian restaurants around. Period.

I have visiting this restaurant in the past a lot of times, but today I was really disappointed. I don’t know if they have a different manager?  I have ordered a Fisherman’s salad, thinking that I will get a lot of seefood in it, like the description was saying for the huge price of $25.00. what i got was a lot of salad and just three shrimp and one bite of salmon. After I have complained about it, the manager came and was pretty unfriendly asking me what I want? I said that for this price I was expecting more see food and he brought three shrimp. I will never ever get the Fisherman’s salad there and I don’t really know if I would go there again. This was just a very bad experience.
One of the most successful restaurants in the area - always a crowd. The food is good, but prices seem a bit high. Atmosphere has a flavor of prestige.
This one of my favorite places for quality food. Fantastic service, great view of the lake, perfect place to have dinner with your family and friends.

Ants everywhere!! Do not eat here! 
Used to be amazing. 
Unfortunately under new management and we refused to pay food was cold, not a lot there and we were the only ones in there On a Saturday night!! Staff are very rude! Gave me a dust pan and brush to clean the bit of mess my children had made and grabbed my baby wipes out of my bag to clean the ants off the table. 
It’s such a shame! It used to be such a Lovely warm welcoming restaurant.

Had a lovely meal for my daughters 21st. Staff were lovely.  Place was exceptionally clean . only one criticism, some dishes were not filled up and ice cream sides weren't there. But overall a good experience

Went here today with family of 15. 23/9/17 had a great night. Interior is very nice, spacious and relaxing. Food was also very nice. I'm particular about my Asian food but it was all nice. Staff very helpful. Can't wait to go again.
Good customer service and lovely food. Not my first visit and will defiently not be my last
Really nice Chinese section. Experiences with other buffets. I  found going too early, the food okay, but not great. Haven't gone early here yet
